author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Department of Physics, Alagappa University, organised a two-day National seminar on “Recent advancements in frontier areas of material science for the benefit of researchers in the region” here on Wednesday.

Addressing the seminar, Prof. S Subbiah, Vice-Chancellor, Alagappa University, stressed the importance of materials science in serving the society.

“It is an inter-disciplinary field which merges the various science and technology and the faculty should emphasis both academic as well as research for the uplift of the society,” he said.

Prof P. Ramasamy, Director, SSN Research Centre, SSN College of Engineering, Chennai, in his inaugural address pointed out the change of scenario in the research environment prevailing in India.

“Days are not far off to see the eminent scientists around world to visit and to work in research institutions in India,” he said, adding Alagappa University would also attract scientists around the world to pursue their research activities.

Prof V. Alagappan, Syndicate Member, Alagappa University, appreciated the contribution of our ancestors to the field of metallurgy and narrated the recent developments in the materials science.

He appreciated the efforts made by the department to organise this seminar for the benefit of the researchers in and around the Karaikudi region. About 100 scientists and research scholars from various institutions attended the seminar.
title: Importance of materials science in serving society stressed
